actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with dominant military, economic, technological, and cultural influence. Leader in innovation, finance, and international diplomacy.

sub_actors.name: Executive Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Core executive branch leadership including the President, cabinet, and key advisors. Primary source of national policy direction and federal executive authority.

sub_actors.name: United States Congress
sub_actors.description: Federal legislative branch comprising Senate and House of Representatives. Controls federal budget, legislation, and oversight of executive branch.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central bank managing national monetary policy, banking supervision, and financial stability. Controls interest rates and money supply.

sub_actors.name: Department of Defense
sub_actors.description: Manages all military forces and national defense policy. Largest department by budget with extensive global presence and strategic influence.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Court of the United States
sub_actors.description: Highest federal court and constitutional interpreter. Final arbiter of federal law and constitutional questions.

sub_actors.name: Department of State
sub_actors.description: Lead foreign affairs agency conducting diplomacy and international relations. Shapes global policy and manages foreign service.

sub_actors.name: National Security Council
sub_actors.description: Principal forum for national security policy decisions and coordination between military, intelligence, and diplomatic agencies.

sub_actors.name: Department of the Treasury
sub_actors.description: Manages federal finances, tax collection, public debt, and financial intelligence. Key economic policy advisor to President.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: Rising superpower with world's largest population, second-largest economy, growing military capabilities, and extensive global infrastructure initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: Ruling political party that controls all aspects of governance, sets national policy, and maintains absolute leadership over state, military, and society

sub_actors.name: Central Military Commission
sub_actors.description: Supreme military command organization that controls the People's Liberation Army, nuclear forces, and military policy

sub_actors.name: State Council
sub_actors.description: Chief administrative authority of China, executing laws and managing daily governance of the nation

sub_actors.name: Politburo Standing Committee
sub_actors.description: Top decision-making body within the CCP, comprising 7 most powerful leaders who shape all major national policies

sub_actors.name: People's Bank of China
sub_actors.description: Central bank controlling monetary policy, currency management, and financial system regulation

sub_actors.name: Ministry of State Security
sub_actors.description: Principal intelligence and security agency handling domestic and foreign intelligence operations

sub_actors.name: National Development and Reform Commission
sub_actors.description: Macroeconomic management agency that controls economic planning, reforms, and strategic projects

sub_actors.name: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
sub_actors.description: Chief anti-corruption agency with broad powers to investigate party members and government officials

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Powerful economic and political union of 27 states, representing significant trade bloc and regulatory influence.

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch of the EU, proposes legislation, implements decisions, upholds treaties, and represents EU internationally. Led by Commission President.

sub_actors.name: European Council
sub_actors.description: Comprises heads of state/government of member states, sets EU's political direction and priorities at highest level.

sub_actors.name: European Parliament
sub_actors.description: Directly elected legislative body that passes EU laws jointly with Council, supervises institutions, and adopts EU budgets.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Controls EU monetary policy, manages euro, and supervises banking system across eurozone.

sub_actors.name: Council of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Voice of EU member governments, adopts laws and coordinates policies. Different ministers meet based on policy area.

sub_actors.name: Court of Justice of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Ensures EU law is interpreted and applied uniformly across member states, resolves legal disputes.

sub_actors.name: European External Action Service
sub_actors.description: EU's diplomatic service, implements foreign and security policy, manages diplomatic relations and strategic partnerships.

sub_actors.name: European Banking Authority
sub_actors.description: Regulatory agency ensuring effective banking supervision across EU, creates banking standards and stress tests.

actors.name: Meta Platforms
actors.description: Controls dominant social media platforms affecting global communication, information flow, and public discourse for billions.

sub_actors.name: Meta Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Highest governing body providing strategic oversight, major policy decisions, and corporate governance. Controls company direction and executive accountability.

sub_actors.name: Meta Executive Leadership Team
sub_actors.description: C-suite executives led by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, responsible for day-to-day operations, product strategy, and company-wide policy implementation.

sub_actors.name: Meta Oversight Board
sub_actors.description: Independent content moderation body making binding decisions on platform governance, content policies, and user appeals.

sub_actors.name: Meta Policy and Communications
sub_actors.description: Division managing regulatory affairs, public policy, government relations, and external communications strategy globally.

sub_actors.name: Meta Security Operations
sub_actors.description: Department responsible for platform integrity, security protocols, and protecting against threats to company infrastructure and user data.

sub_actors.name: Meta Product Development
sub_actors.description: Division controlling product roadmap, feature development, and technical implementation across all Meta platforms.

sub_actors.name: Meta AI Research (FAIR)
sub_actors.description: Research division developing artificial intelligence technologies that influence platform algorithms and future capabilities.

sub_actors.name: Meta Reality Labs
sub_actors.description: Division focusing on metaverse development, VR/AR technologies, and next-generation platform evolution.

actors.name: United Nations
actors.description: Primary international organization for global governance, peace-keeping, and humanitarian coordination.

sub_actors.name: UN Security Council
sub_actors.description: Primary decision-making body for international peace and security, with power to issue binding resolutions and authorize military action

sub_actors.name: UN General Assembly
sub_actors.description: Main deliberative body where all member states have equal representation, sets policies and budget

sub_actors.name: UN Secretariat
sub_actors.description: Executive arm led by Secretary-General, manages operations and implements policies

sub_actors.name: UN Economic and Social Council
sub_actors.description: Coordinates economic, social, and environmental work of UN agencies and bodies

sub_actors.name: UN Department of Peacekeeping Operations
sub_actors.description: Plans, prepares, manages, and directs UN peacekeeping operations worldwide

sub_actors.name: International Court of Justice
sub_actors.description: Principal judicial organ of the UN, settles legal disputes between states

sub_actors.name: UN Human Rights Council
sub_actors.description: Inter-governmental body responsible for promoting and protecting human rights worldwide

sub_actors.name: UN Development Programme
sub_actors.description: Global development network focusing on poverty reduction and sustainable development

actors.name: NATO
actors.description: Powerful military alliance ensuring collective defense and security cooperation among 31 North American and European nations.

sub_actors.name: North Atlantic Council (NAC)
sub_actors.description: Principal political decision-making body of NATO where each member nation has a seat. Makes major strategic and policy decisions requiring unanimous consent.

sub_actors.name: Military Committee (MC)
sub_actors.description: Senior military authority providing strategic advice to NAC and directing NATO's military operations through Strategic Commands.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR)
sub_actors.description: Commands all NATO military operations and oversees strategic planning for Alliance military activities.

sub_actors.name: NATO Secretary General Office
sub_actors.description: Chief spokesperson and principal political leader of NATO, chairs the NAC and oversees strategic direction.

sub_actors.name: Allied Command Operations (ACO)
sub_actors.description: Responsible for planning and executing all NATO military operations, headquartered at SHAPE in Belgium.

sub_actors.name: NATO Intelligence and Security Division
sub_actors.description: Provides strategic intelligence analysis and security risk assessments to support NATO decision-making.

sub_actors.name: Nuclear Planning Group (NPG)
sub_actors.description: High-level body responsible for nuclear policy and planning within the Alliance framework.

sub_actors.name: Science and Technology Organization (STO)
sub_actors.description: NATO's principal organization for science and technology research, fostering innovation in defense capabilities.

actors.name: Apple Inc.
actors.description: Tech giant with massive market influence, setting global standards in technology, consumer behavior, and digital ecosystems.

sub_actors.name: Apple Executive Team
sub_actors.description: Top-level leadership team headed by CEO, making strategic decisions and setting company direction across all divisions and products

sub_actors.name: Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Governing body providing oversight, strategic guidance, and major corporate decisions approval

sub_actors.name: Product Development Division
sub_actors.description: Core division responsible for iPhone, iPad, Mac and other flagship product development and innovation

sub_actors.name: Software Engineering Division
sub_actors.description: Controls iOS, macOS development and ecosystem integration, critical for product functionality and user experience

sub_actors.name: Operations and Supply Chain
sub_actors.description: Manages global manufacturing, logistics, and supply chain operations essential for product delivery

sub_actors.name: Services Division
sub_actors.description: Manages Apple's growing services ecosystem including App Store, Apple Music, iCloud, and other digital services

sub_actors.name: Legal and Global Security
sub_actors.description: Handles legal compliance, intellectual property, security, and regulatory affairs worldwide

sub_actors.name: Marketing and Communications
sub_actors.description: Controls brand messaging, product launches, and global marketing strategies

actors.name: Russian Federation
actors.description: Major military power with significant energy resources, nuclear capabilities, and geopolitical influence.

sub_actors.name: Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Executive office holding supreme authority over state affairs, military command, and foreign policy, with extensive constitutional powers and direct control over security services

sub_actors.name: Security Council of Russia
sub_actors.description: Presidential advisory body coordinating national security policy, military doctrine, and strategic planning with key government and security leaders

sub_actors.name: Federal Security Service (FSB)
sub_actors.description: Primary security agency handling counter-intelligence, internal security, and border protection with extensive domestic surveillance capabilities

sub_actors.name: Russian Armed Forces
sub_actors.description: Unified military command structure controlling all military branches, nuclear forces, and conducting military operations domestically and abroad

sub_actors.name: United Russia Party
sub_actors.description: Dominant political party holding constitutional majority in parliament, implementing presidential policies and maintaining political control

sub_actors.name: Ministry of Defense
sub_actors.description: Controls military budget, defense procurement, and military strategy implementation, directly oversees armed forces operations

sub_actors.name: Central Bank of Russia
sub_actors.description: National financial regulator controlling monetary policy, currency operations, and banking sector oversight

sub_actors.name: Gazprom
sub_actors.description: State-controlled energy corporation wielding significant economic influence through control of natural gas resources and export infrastructure

actors.name: International Monetary Fund
actors.description: Key institution in global financial system, influencing international monetary policies and economic stability.

sub_actors.name: Executive Board
sub_actors.description: Primary decision-making body that exercises most powers of the IMF Board of Governors, consisting of 24 Directors representing member countries or groups of countries

sub_actors.name: Board of Governors
sub_actors.description: Highest decision-making body consisting of one governor and one alternate governor for each member country, typically finance ministers or central bank heads

sub_actors.name: Managing Director's Office
sub_actors.description: Leadership office headed by the Managing Director who oversees the IMF's operations, policy direction, and serves as chair of the Executive Board

sub_actors.name: Strategy, Policy, and Review Department
sub_actors.description: Central department responsible for developing IMF policies and ensuring consistency in IMF policy advice and lending practices

sub_actors.name: Research Department
sub_actors.description: Produces key economic analysis and research that underpins IMF policy advice and global economic surveillance

sub_actors.name: International Monetary and Financial Committee
sub_actors.description: Advisory body that provides strategic direction to the work and policies of the IMF

sub_actors.name: Area Departments
sub_actors.description: Regional divisions responsible for country-specific policy implementation and monitoring across different geographical regions

sub_actors.name: Finance Department
sub_actors.description: Manages the IMF's financial resources and operations, including lending policies and quota system

actors.name: Alphabet Inc.
actors.description: Parent company of Google, controlling crucial digital infrastructure, information access, and technological innovation.

sub_actors.name: Google LLC
sub_actors.description: Core subsidiary managing search, advertising, cloud services, and primary revenue streams. Controls key digital infrastructure and technology development.

sub_actors.name: Alphabet Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Supreme governing body making final decisions on company strategy, acquisitions, and leadership appointments.

sub_actors.name: Google AI/DeepMind
sub_actors.description: Leads artificial intelligence research and development, shaping future technology capabilities and strategic direction.

sub_actors.name: Google Cloud
sub_actors.description: Manages cloud computing infrastructure and enterprise services, critical for revenue growth and market expansion.

sub_actors.name: YouTube
sub_actors.description: Controls global video distribution platform, influencing content policies and digital advertising.

sub_actors.name: X Development LLC
sub_actors.description: Research facility for moonshot technologies, directing long-term innovation strategy and future ventures.

sub_actors.name: Android Division
sub_actors.description: Manages mobile operating system development, controlling smartphone ecosystem and app distribution.

sub_actors.name: Waymo
sub_actors.description: Autonomous vehicle technology division, leading development in self-driving transportation systems.
